docs.lead_paragraph: The demise of one of broadcasting’s oldest institutions, the daytime soap opera, crept closer Thursday as ABC announced it would end two of its long-running daily serial dramas, “All My Children” and “One Life to Live.”

headline.main: ABC Cancels ‘All My Children’ and ‘One Life to Live’

docs.abstract: ABC announced it will pull the plug on two of its long-running daily serial dramas, “All My Children” and “One Life to Live.”
docs.snippet: ABC announced it will pull the plug on two of its long-running daily serial dramas, “All My Children” and “One Life to Live.”

docs.lead_paragraph: The Egg-Bot Kit, designed and sold on the Evil Mad Scientist Web site, prints detailed illustrations on spherical or ellipsoid objects using standard fine-tip markers. Besides eggs, you can ink things like Christmas tree ornaments. The device, in essence, is an updated pen plotter. Designs made in the app, working with Inkscape, an open-source vector graphics editor similar to Adobe Illustrator and CorelDraw, are sent via software built by Evil Mad Scientist to the USB-tethered Egg-Bot. The machine then plots each layer of color on the object, automatically rotating it to wrap the image around. Since the Egg-Bot can hold only one pen at a time, you have to manually switch colors between layers.

headline.main: Just the Ticket for One-Upmanship at the Egg Roll

docs.abstract: Gadgetwise blog suggests Egg-Bot Kit, which prints detailed illustrations on spherical or ellpsoid objects, for decorating Easter eggs; photo (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: In this week's New York Times Magazine, Gary Taubes, author most recently of "Why We Get Fat: And What to Do About It," takes on sugar. Among other things, he writes about the views of Robert Lustig, an obesity expert at the University of California, San Francisco, School of Medicine.

headline.main: Talk to Gary Taubes About Sugar

docs.abstract: Health writer Gary Taubes responds to reader questions about sugar and why we get fat.
docs.snippet: Health writer Gary Taubes responds to reader questions about sugar and why we get fat.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the scheme of things, saving the 38 billion bucks that Congress seems poised to agree upon is not a big deal. A big deal is saving a trillion bucks. And we could do that by preventing disease instead of treating it.

headline.main: How to Save a Trillion Dollars

docs.abstract: As Congress tries to get the budget under control, it's worth noting the fiscal toll of treating "lifestyle diseases."
docs.snippet: As Congress tries to get the budget under control, it's worth noting the fiscal toll of treating "lifestyle diseases."

headline.main: Get With the Programs: Exploring the Implications of Federal Budget Cuts

docs.lead_paragraph: A report to be released by the Manhattan borough president says community groups hoping to open farmers’ markets in low-income city neighborhoods face excessive fees and confusing rules.
